description: Calculator supports basic operations: add, subtract, multiply, divide
validationSteps: Launch the app
Compute 7 + 5 and verify display shows 12
Compute 9 - 4 and verify display shows 5
Compute 6 * 7 and verify display shows 42
Compute 8 / 2 and verify display shows 4

description: Calculator supports mouse operation via standard keys (0-9, ., +, -, *, /, =, C, backspace)
validationSteps: Launch the app
Click buttons to enter a multi-digit number (e.g. 123) and verify display updates
Click an operator and another number, then '=' and verify result
Use 'C' to clear and verify display resets
Use backspace and verify last digit is removed

description: Calculator supports keyboard input matching the UI keys
validationSteps: Launch the app and focus the window
Type digits 0-9 and verify display updates
Type +, -, *, / and verify operator is applied
Press Enter for '=' and verify result
Press Escape for clear and Backspace to delete

description: Calculator display uses black background with bright green text
validationSteps: Launch the app
Verify the calculator display area has a black background
Verify the displayed digits are bright green

description: Project builds with Go 1.25 and uses Fyne for the UI
validationSteps: Run 'go version' and confirm Go 1.25 is used
Run 'go test ./...' and confirm tests execute
Run 'go run ./cmd/calculator' and confirm the UI launches

description: Use Go 1.25 features when feasible (range over integers; sync.WaitGroup.Go in tests)
validationSteps: Search code for at least one 'for i := range N' loop
Search tests for usage of 'wg.Go('
Run 'go test ./...' successfully
